conclusion: Analyze the image to determine which container the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles.
The baffles are rectangular shapes with blue outlines at the bottom and white outlines at the top, placed at the bottom of the image.
The arrows indicate the direction of the liquid flow, showing liquid flowing out from A, B, C, and D.
The liquid is flowing out from the top of the baffles (A, B, C, and D) and then into the bottom of the baffles (E and F).
The baffles are designed to separate the liquid flow into different paths.
Since the liquid flows out from the top of the baffles and then into the bottom, it will flow into the container at the bottom of the baffles (E and F).
Liquid will flow into container E after passing through the baffles.
